intro: Gnaphalium psilophyllum, commonly known as the slender cudweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a low-growing herbaceous perennial that typically reaches a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and covered with fine, silky hairs, contributing to its characteristic appearance. Native to regions of Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, grassy habitats and is often found in meadows and along stream banks.
